adDetails: One-on-one metal sculpture classes at a Bay Area Landmark Studio. All ages welcome: a great way for the whole family to spend time together. Students receive instruction that meets their needs, from beginner to advanced. The instructor is an internationally known Bay Area Master Sculptor. He has pieces in major collections throughout the Bay Area, and has completed commissions for the cities of Oakland and Eureka, California. His work has been exhibited in Milan, Tokyo, Copenhagen, and other major cities around the world. He has taught at California College of the Arts (CCA), the San Francisco Art Institute and the International Sculpture Conference. Classes are held in a fully equipped sculpture studio. Students learn about a range of tools and techniques including forging, mig welding, pulse welding, tig welding, plasma cutting, machine shop, 60-ton press forming, and oxygen cutting, as well as design principles. Individualized lessons are tailored to each students' needs. SAFETY EQUIPMENT AND MATERIALS INCLUDED. Secure parking.
